intro: [WRONG START] Vetenatia humifusa, commonly known as the groundsel or groundsel weed, is a low-growing, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It typically features a mat-forming growth habit with numerous small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has hairy, fleshy leaves that are often clustered at the base, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. Ventenatia humifusa is adapted to arid conditions and can tolerate poor soil quality.
